page.title: 08THE LEISURE CENTRE
page.content: The chairman of the Leisure centre is a local teacher,Mr. Alun Jones.The Leisure Centre was originally built as a woollen mill, then used as a warehouse during the Second World War and subsequently. In 1981 plans were drawn up to convert it into a sports complex and social club, and this work commenced in 1982. It is run by a Management Committee made up of volunteers from the area.The Centre provides a range of sporting activities in an area which lacked facilities and requires the support of the local community to make sure the facilities offered at the Centre are maintained. The facilities offered are Squash,Badmington,Table Tennis, Eight Ball Pool,Pin Ball, Indoor Bowls, Judo, Japanese Sword Fighting, as well as Keep Fit and Aerobics Classes. {JOANNE LOTE & GREG LING LLOYD
